titlealts.searchtitle: HPE Helion Openstack 1.1: Gateway Pools, Users and Sub-users, Access and Secret Keys

body.p: This topic explains how Ceph Object Gateways create pools to store data and how users access these pools.

section.title: Pools
section.p: Ceph Object Gateways require Ceph Storage Cluster pools to store specific gateway data. If user created has permissions, gateway automatically creates pools. To list available pools, enter:

Verify that the .rgw.buckets and .rgw.buckets.index pools are created by default. If not, create these pools using ceph osd pool create command. For more details, refer to http://https://ceph.com/docs/master/radosgw/config-ref#pools

section.title: User and Sub-User
section.p: The User is a user of the S3 interface, and Sub-user is a user of Swift interface. The sub-user is always associated to a user. For details, refer to https://ceph.com/docs/master/radosgw/admin/.
